thread.title: Emirates announces Bangkok Airlines codeshare deal
thread.title_full: Emirates announces Bangkok Airlines codeshare deal

title: Emirates announces Bangkok Airlines codeshare deal
text:
0 comments Tom Newcombe Wed, 5 Aug 2015 11:42 Follow @thomasnewcombe Emirates has announced a codeshare agreement with Thai-based carrier Bangkok Airlines.
The new deal will see Emirates’ code added to 19 Bangkok Airways routes across a number of southeast Asian cities, adding 14 new destinations to the Gulf carrier’s global network.
Passengers travelling to Bangkok Suvranabhumi, Phuket, Kuala Lumpur and Singapore will be able to take advantage of Bangkok Airways codeshare routes. This agreement also offers a choice of stopover in Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore and Phuket for Emirates passengers.
Emirates executive VP and CCO Thierry Antinori, said: "Our new codeshare agreement with Bangkok Airways will provide our passengers with increased choice, flexibility and ease of connection to different cities across Southeast Asia to and from Dubai, ultimately offering a smoother, more convenient travel experience.
